channel.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
channel.description: I started patching a shimmer delay using the pitch shifters of @SirSickSik: It's really simple but the sounds you can get out of it a really nice, I will make some example tomorrow propably. Further Ideas: - Filtering in the feedback path - Using even more delay reads with slightly different settings and pan them in the stereo field Enjoy! Grain : Shimmer Delay.axs (11.2 KB)

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

fixed the semitone bug of the pitchshifter! (as far as I can see now at least... when I came home this evening it suddenly responded totally differently from when I left home.... very weird)

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

I have been wondering now about the built in delay in the pitch shifter. It's there no matter what it seems. Maybe a future version with no delay? there is a short slap back present if you keep the pitch know at around 11-14 o clock.
But thanks for making this!!

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

I'll get into that later, at the moment I'm focussing on a "mystery oscillator" (see my contributions thread for link to demo)

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

SirSickSik:

I'll look into it, maybe it's better to just leave the recording part outside the pitchshifter module then..

That's a good Idea! For my application one delay write for several delay reads is completely sufficient.

One thing I also noticed is that some notes are shifted in a clean intervall while others are bit out of tune. Is this because some notes are closer or a harmonic of the Frequency at the Hz inlet? I compensated this by using several pitchshifters with different windosizes and hz settings.

For the rest it works really great! A version with pitch rather than Hz inlet would be nice though

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

oh ok, I hadn't noticed that yet.. good to know for my own projects!
I'll look into it, maybe it's better to just leave the recording part outside the pitchshifter module then..

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Ah this is good to know thanks!

Do you know if there is any formula to calculate specific invervals with the combination of HZ and depth? Right know I am doing try and error but I you wanted to set it to specfic intervals that would come handy!

Edit:
Tried it out without the delay, makes the pitchshifting sound really lo fi with a lot digital artefacts. Quite interesting too but not really what I'm looking for.
Do I have this setup right?

Bildschirmfoto 2016-05-26 um 16.09.29.png2482x1054 195 KB
Grainy Pitch Delay no Write.axp (7.6 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

you don't need that extra delay module. the pitchshifter has that inbuild in itself, so this could save you some memory by just sending the audio into the pitchshifter.

Read full topic

item.title: Grain / Shimmer Delay
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

I started patching a shimmer delay using the pitch shifters of @SirSickSik:

Bildschirmfoto 2016-05-26 um 02.21.27.png2560x998 212 KB

It's really simple but the sounds you can get out of it a really nice, I will make some example tomorrow propably.

Further Ideas:
- Filtering in the feedback path
- Using even more delay reads with slightly different settings and pan them in the stereo field

Enjoy!

Grain : Shimmer Delay.axs (11.2 KB)

Read full topic
